item.title: Android’s December 2024 Security Update Patches 14 Vulnerabilities
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Google has released patches for 14 high-severity vulnerabilities as part of Android’s December 2024 security update.

The post Android’s December 2024 Security Update Patches 14 Vulnerabilities appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Industry Moves for the week of December 2, 2024 - SecurityWeek
item.description: Explore industry moves and significant changes in the industry for the week of December 2, 2024. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and shifts.

item.title: Solana Web3.js Library Backdoored in Supply Chain Attack
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Supply chain attack leads to decentralized application developers downloading backdoored versions of the Solana Web3.js library.

The post Solana Web3.js Library Backdoored in Supply Chain Attack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Law Enforcement Read Criminals’ Messages After Hacking Matrix Service
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Law enforcement has taken down yet another encrypted messaging service used by criminals, but not before spying on its users.

The post Law Enforcement Read Criminals’ Messages After Hacking Matrix Service appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: FBI Tells Telecom Firms to Boost Security Following Wide-Ranging Chinese Hacking Campaign
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
Guidance issued by the FBI and CISA is intended to help root out the hackers and prevent similar cyberespionage.

The post FBI Tells Telecom Firms to Boost Security Following Wide-Ranging Chinese Hacking Campaign appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: New EU Regulation Establishes European ‘Cybersecurity Shield’
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The European Union has adopted new legislation to establish a cybersecurity shield and ensure adequate security standards for managed security services.

The post New EU Regulation Establishes European ‘Cybersecurity Shield’ appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Vendors Unveil New Cloud Security Products, Features at AWS re:Invent 2024
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
AWS and other vendors have announced new cloud security products and features at the cloud giant’s re:Invent 2024 conference.

The post Vendors Unveil New Cloud Security Products, Features at AWS re:Invent 2024 appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: US Expands List of Chinese Technology Companies Under Export Controls
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
Commerce Department expanded the list of Chinese technology companies subject to export controls to include many that make equipment used to make computer chips, chipmaking tools and software.

The post US Expands List of Chinese Technology Companies Under Export Controls appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Hacker Conversations: Dan McInerney and Puzzle-Driven Hacking
item.dc:creator: Kevin Townsend
item.description:
McInerney’s path to becoming a hacker is subtly different to many other hackers. He started as a 22-year old psychology graduate rather than a computer-obsessed 9-year old kid.

The post Hacker Conversations: Dan McInerney and Puzzle-Driven Hacking appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: 760,000 Employee Records From Several Major Firms Leaked Online
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
A hacker has posted online over 760,000 records belonging to employees of Bank of America, Koch, Nokia, JLL, Xerox, Morgan Stanley, and Bridgewater.

The post 760,000 Employee Records From Several Major Firms Leaked Online appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Hackers Stole $1.49 Billion in Cryptocurrency to Date in 2024
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Hackers have caused close to $1.49 billion in cryptocurrency losses this year, with $71 million worth of assets stolen in November.

The post Hackers Stole $1.49 Billion in Cryptocurrency to Date in 2024 appeared first on SecurityWeek.
